alert.note: Alert for Elk (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 10:22PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Elk, central Wilson, southwestern Woodson and southeastern Greenwood Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1022 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Eureka to 5 miles south of Fall River. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Fredonia, Altoona, Toronto, Hamilton, Severy, Buffalo, Fall River, Benedict, Climax, Virgil, New Albany, Coyville, Eureka City Lake, Eureka Airport, Toronto Lake, Batesville, Fall River State Park, Fall River Lake and Cross Timbers State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for south central and southeastern Kansas.
